column2: @AnthonyLeeZhang We all try our best to give our kids the tools to thrive based on our own life experiences. Unfortunately the world we grew up with no longer exists. And all the rules change so our advice is irrelevant.

@AnthonyLeeZhang Many Asian immigrant parents went through trauma. Cultural Revolution, Korean War, Vietnam War. Many had wealth suddenly stripped away. No sense of security.

Youâ€™re in a foreign, potentially racist country. No matter what happens, at least they canâ€™t take away your kidâ€™s degree.

12/ Listen to the full episode where Will talks to us about:
- web3 gaming guilds
- how @darkforest_eth works
- forming @d_fdao
- @alliancedao accelerator for the top 1% Web3 founders

https://t.co/IUf6iVIin8
11/ Together, they achieve the unimaginable. https://t.co/2azkXliOV7

10/ Will discovers @zhayitong. Through his blog about captaining an empire in Dark Forest. Also ex-Coinbase - UX/UI.

Will enrolls @TheDavidZhou & @cha0sg0d_. Straight out of college. With actual time to play the game. 

And @llpresswell who becomes their media arm. https://t.co/Oy6NPiFhIm

9/ Unable to break the top 30, Will finds @Manan19 ranked high on the Dark Forest leaderboards and DMs him on Twitter. Turns out Manan is a managing engineer at Coinbase. Manan joins and provides the plugins. https://t.co/lxKCjVnhq8

8/ With no coding abilities or time. No chance at winning the game. Will decides to recruit a top-tier guild.

His first recruit is @omarish. 100x engineer. ex-Coinbase, ex-EIR at Paradigm. He sets them up with AWS. https://t.co/GD8LEq4xmq

7/ What players do to win is to write scripts.

Better UX. Better UI. Faster Experience. The games are no longer played by humans. They're played by robots and the players are there to maintain them. https://t.co/1ePee6MywR
6/ @darkforest_eth is a Web3 game where you conquer planets to build empires. Since you can interact directly with the smart contract, hacking becomes part of the game. https://t.co/pMJiP98ceJ

5/ Guilds that Build.

Developer guilds that build alongside the creators of the game. 

Will's Dark Forest guild @d_fdao is one of those guilds.

4/ Guilds that Show.

Guilds like @HoogaGaming @lorcan_gg create spectacle. Pro players who play tournaments as performers.

3/ Guilds that Shill.

Guilds like @YieldGuild @ReadyPlayerDAO onboard new players by providing scholarships. The amount of players they have give them incredible leverage. 

They can point their players to any new IP and make it a hit. 
A marketing arm for Web3 games.

2/ There are three types of guilds forming in Web3 games.

1. Guilds that Shill
2. Guilds that Show
3. Guilds that Build

1/ Gaming guilds are the kingmakers of Web3 games.

@DangerWillRobin (@alliancedao)  has built the most fascinating guild for the most fascinating Web3 game ğŸ§µğŸ‘‡: https://t.co/EoMCo1Coal

2/ Bitcoin was a reaction to the financial crisis. To the Patriot Act. To the draconian drug laws.

We brought on a friend to discuss the philosophy of Bitcoin. We discuss his days as a professional poker player. And his experience with Silk Road.

https://t.co/L0SnAgrwWX

1/ I've seen 3 waves of crypto onboarding. Each wave bringing in a new cohort with a different set of values.

1. Individual sovereignty. 
Bitcoin run up to $1,000 (W'13)

2. Technology platform. 
Ethereum run up to $1,000 (W'17)

3. Community.
Bored Ape run up to 100 eth (W'21)
